front.title: Maximum Prefix Outbound Route Filter for BGP

abstract.t: This document introduces a Maximum Prefix ORF (Outbound Route Filtering) type for BGP. It aims to provide a mechanism whereby the sender of route information is informed of the maximum number of prefixes that the receiver is willing to accept. This facilitates improved resource management by limiting the number of routes exchanged, avoiding unnecessary or excessive route propagation, and reducing memory and CPU load.
